   19: %%
   20: %%% Purpose : Test records.
   21: 
   22: -module(record_no_copt_ssa_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   27: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   28: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   29: 	 errors/1,record_test_2/1,record_test_3/1,record_access_in_guards/1,
   30: 	 guard_opt/1,eval_once/1,foobar/1,missing_test_heap/1,
   31: 	 nested_access/1,coverage/1,grab_bag/1,slow_compilation/1]).
   32: 
   33: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   34:     Config.
   35: 
   36: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   37:     ok.
   38: 
   39: suite() ->
   40:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   41:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   42: 
   43: all() -> 
   44:     [{group,p}].
   45: 
   46: groups() -> 
   47:     [{p,test_lib:parallel(),
   48:       [errors,record_test_2,record_test_3,
   49:        record_access_in_guards,guard_opt,eval_once,foobar,
   50:        missing_test_heap,nested_access,coverage,grab_bag,
   51:        slow_compilation]}].
   52: 
   53: 
   54: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   55:     _ = id(Config),                  %Make return value unpredicatble.
   56:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   57:     Config.
   58: 
   59: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   60:     ok.
   61: 
   62: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   63:     Config.
   64: 
   65: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   66:     Config.
   67: 
   68: 
   69: -record(foo, {a,b,c,d}).
   70: -record(bar, {a,b,c,d}).
   71: -record(barf, {a,b,c,d,e}).
   72: 
   73: errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   74:     Foo = #foo{a=1,b=2,c=3,d=4},
   75:     #foo{a=19,b=42,c=3,d=4} = update_foo(Foo, 19, 42),
   76: 
   77:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19)),
   78:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35)),
   79:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35, 17)),
   80:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35, 17, 42)),
   81: 
   82:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19)),
   83:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35)),
   84:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35, 17)),
   85:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35, 17, 42)),
   86:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19,
   87:                                                           35, 17, 42, -2)),
   88: 
   89:     ok.
   90: 
   91: update_foo(#foo{}=R, A, B) ->
   92:     R#foo{a=A,b=B}.
   93: 
   94: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A) ->
   95:     R#bar{a=A}.
   96: 
   97: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B) ->
   98:     R#bar{a=A,b=A}.
   99: 
  100: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C) ->
  101:     R#bar{a=A,b=A,c=C}.
  102: 
  103: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D) ->
  104:     R#bar{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D}.
  105: 
  106: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A) ->
  107:     R#barf{a=A}.
  108: 
  109: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B) ->
  110:     R#barf{a=A,b=A}.
  111: 
  112: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C) ->
  113:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C}.
  114: 
  115: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D) ->
  116:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D}.
  117: 
  118: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D, E) ->
  119:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D,e=E}.
  120: 
  121: 
  122: -define(TrueGuard(Expr), if Expr -> ok; true -> ct:fail(failed) end).
  123: -define(FalseGuard(Expr), if Expr -> ct:fail(failed); true -> ok end).
  124: 				
  125: record_test_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  126:     true = is_record(#foo{}, foo),
  127:     false = is_record(#foo{}, barf),
  128:     false = is_record({foo}, foo),
  129: 
  130:     true = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo),
  131:     false = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf),
  132:     false = erlang:is_record({foo}, foo),
  133: 
  134:     false = is_record([], foo),
  135:     false = is_record(Config, foo),
  136: 
  137:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  138:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  139:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo)),
  140: 
  141:     ?TrueGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  142:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  143:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record({foo}, foo)),
  144: 
  145:     ?FalseGuard(is_record([], foo)),
  146:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Config, foo)),
  147: 
  148:     %% 'not is_record/2' to test guard optimization.
  149: 
  150:     ?FalseGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  151:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  152:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record({foo}, foo)),
  153: 
  154:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  155:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  156:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record({foo}, foo)),
  157: 
  158:     Foo = id(#foo{}),
  159:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, foo)),
  160:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, barf)),
  161: 
  162:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(Config, foo)),
  163: 
  164:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(a, foo)),
  165:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record([], foo)),
  166: 
  167:     %% Pass non-literal first argument.
  168: 
  169:     true = is_record(id(#foo{}), foo),
  170:     false = is_record(id(#foo{}), barf),
  171:     false = is_record(id({foo}), foo),
  172: 
  173:     true = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), foo),
  174:     false = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), barf),
  175:     false = erlang:is_record(id({foo}), foo),
  176: 
  177:     NoRec1 = id(blurf),
  178:     NoRec2 = id([]),
  179: 
  180:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec1, foo)),
  181:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec2, foo)),
  182: 
  183:     %% The optimizer attempts to move expressions to guards,
  184:     %% but it must not move an is_record/2 call that is not
  185:     %% allowed in a guard in the first place.
  186: 
  187:     ok = case is_record(id({a}), id(a)) of
  188: 		   true -> ok;
  189: 		   false -> error
  190: 	       end,
  191: 
  192:     %% Force the use of guard bifs by using the 'xor' operation.
  193: 
  194:     False = id(false),
  195:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo) xor False),
  196:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf) xor False),
  197:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo) xor False ),
  198: 
  199:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(Foo, foo) xor False),
  200:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Foo, barf) xor False),
  201: 
  202: 
  203:     %% Implicit guards by using a list comprehension.
  204: 
  205:     List = id([1,#foo{a=2},3,#bar{d=4},5,#foo{a=6},7]),
  206: 
  207:     [#foo{a=2},#foo{a=6}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, foo)],
  208:     [#bar{d=4}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, bar)],
  209:     [1,#foo{a=2},3,5,#foo{a=6},7] =
  210: 	[X || X <- List, not is_record(X, bar)],
  211:     [1,3,5,7] =
  212: 	[X || X <- List, ((not is_record(X, bar)) and (not is_record(X, foo)))],
  213:     [#foo{a=2},#bar{d=4},#foo{a=6}] =
  214: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar)) or (is_record(X, foo)))],
  215:     [1,3,#bar{d=4}] =
  216: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar)) or (X < 5))],
  217: 
  218:     MyList = [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}],
  219:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo)],
  220:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo)],
  221:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin is_record(X, foo) end],
  222:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin not is_record(X, foo) end],
  223:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo) or
  224: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  225:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo) or
  226: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  227:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X)],
  228:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo) or
  229: 			     is_reference(X)],
  230:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  231: 				   begin is_record(X, foo) or
  232: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  233:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  234: 				   begin not is_record(X, foo) or
  235: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  236:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  237: 			begin is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X) end],
  238:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  239: 			 begin not is_record(X, foo) or
  240: 				   is_reference(X) end],
  241: 
  242:     Map = id(#{a => 1, b => #foo{a=2}, c => 3, d => #bar{d=4},
  243:                e => 5, f => #foo{a=6}, h => 7}),
  244:     [#foo{a=2},#foo{a=6}] = lists:sort([X || _ := X <- Map, is_record(X, foo)]),
  245:     [#bar{d=4}] = [X || _ := X <- Map, is_record(X, bar)],
  246:     [1,3,5,7,#foo{a=2},#foo{a=6}] =
  247: 	lists:sort([X || _ := X <- Map, not is_record(X, bar)]),
  248:     [2,6] = lists:sort([A || _ := #foo{a=A} <- Map]),
  249: 
  250:     %% Call is_record/2 with illegal arguments.
  251:     [] = [X || X <- [], is_record(t, id(X))],
  252:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch [X || X <- [1], is_record(t, id(X))]),
  253: 
  254:     %% Update several fields with a string literal.
  255:     #barf{} = Barf0 = id(#barf{}),
  256:     Barf = update_barf(Barf0),
  257:     #barf{a="abc",b=1} = id(Barf),
  258: 
  259:     %% Test optimization of is_record/3.
  260:     false = case id({a,b}) of
  261: 		{_,_}=Tuple -> is_record(Tuple, foo)
  262: 	    end,
  263:     false = case id(true) of
  264: 		true=Bool -> is_record(Bool, foo)
  265: 	    end,
  266: 
  267:     ok.
  268: 
  269: record_test_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  270:     true = is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5),
  271:     false = is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5),
  272:     false = is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6),
  273:     false = is_record({foo}, foo, 5),
  274:     false = is_record({foo}, foo, -1),
  275:     false = is_record(id({foo}), foo, -1),
  276: 
  277:     true = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5),
  278:     true = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, id(foo), 5),
  279:     false = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5),
  280:     false = erlang:is_record({foo}, foo, 5),
  281:     false = erlang:is_record({foo}, foo, -1),
  282:     false = erlang:is_record(id({foo}), foo, -1),
  283:     false = erlang:is_record({foo}, id(foo), -1),
  284: 
  285:     false = is_record([], foo),
  286:     false = is_record(Config, foo),
  287: 
  288:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5)),
  289:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5)),
  290:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6)),
  291:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo, 5)),
  292: 
  293:     ?TrueGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5)),
  294:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5)),
  295:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6)),
  296:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record({foo}, foo, 5)),
  297: 
  298:     ?FalseGuard(is_record([], foo, 5)),
  299:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Config, foo, 5)),
  300: 
  301:     %% 'not is_record/2' to test guard optimization.
  302: 
  303:     ?FalseGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5)),
  304:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6)),
  305:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record({foo}, foo, 5)),
  306: 
  307:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5)),
  308:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5)),
  309:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record({foo}, foo, 5)),
  310: 
  311:     Foo = id(#foo{}),
  312:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, foo, 5)),
  313:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, barf, 6)),
  314: 
  315:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(Config, foo, 5)),
  316: 
  317:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(a, foo, 5)),
  318:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record([], foo, 5)),
  319: 
  320:     %% Pass non-literal first argument.
  321: 
  322:     true = is_record(id(#foo{}), foo, 5),
  323:     false = is_record(id(#foo{}), barf, 6),
  324:     false = is_record(id({foo}), foo, 5),
  325: 
  326:     true = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), foo, 5),
  327:     false = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), barf, 6),
  328:     false = erlang:is_record(id({foo}), foo, 5),
  329: 
  330:     NoRec1 = id(blurf),
  331:     NoRec2 = id([]),
  332: 
  333:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec1, foo, 5)),
  334:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec2, foo, 5)),
  335: 
  336:     %% Force the use of guard bifs by using the 'xor' operation.
  337: 
  338:     False = id(false),
  339:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5) xor False),
  340:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6) xor False),
  341:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo, 5) xor False ),
  342: 
  343:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(Foo, foo, 5) xor False),
  344:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Foo, barf, 6) xor False),
  345: 
  346: 
  347:     %% Implicit guards by using a list comprehension.
  348: 
  349:     List = id([1,#foo{a=2},3,#bar{d=4},5,#foo{a=6},7]),
  350: 
  351:     [#foo{a=2},#foo{a=6}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, foo, 5)],
  352:     [#bar{d=4}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, bar, 5)],
  353:     [1,#foo{a=2},3,5,#foo{a=6},7] =
  354: 	[X || X <- List, not is_record(X, bar, 5)],
  355:     [1,3,5,7] =
  356: 	[X || X <- List, ((not is_record(X, bar, 5)) and (not is_record(X, foo, 5)))],
  357:     [#foo{a=2},#bar{d=4},#foo{a=6}] =
  358: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar, 5)) or (is_record(X, foo, 5)))],
  359:     [1,3,#bar{d=4}] =
  360: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar, 5)) or (X < 5))],
  361: 
  362:     MyList = [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}],
  363:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo, 5)],
  364:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo, 5)],
  365:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin is_record(X, foo, 5) end],
  366:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin not is_record(X, foo, 5) end],
  367:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  368: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  369:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  370: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  371:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X)],
  372:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo) or
  373: 			     is_reference(X)],
  374:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  375: 				   begin is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  376: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  377:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  378: 				   begin not is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  379: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  380:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  381: 			begin is_record(X, foo, 5) or is_reference(X) end],
  382:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  383: 			 begin not is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  384: 				   is_reference(X) end],
  385: 
  386:     %% Update several fields with a string literal.
  387:     #barf{} = Barf0 = id(#barf{}),
  388:     Barf = update_barf(Barf0),
  389:     #barf{a="abc",b=1} = id(Barf),
  390: 
  391:     %% Non-literal arguments.
  392:     true = is_record(id(#barf{}), id(barf), id(6)),
  393:     false = is_record(id(#barf{}), id(barf), id(42)),
  394:     false = is_record(id(#barf{}), id(foo), id(6)),
  395: 
  396:     Rec = id(#barf{}),
  397:     Good = id(barf),
  398:     Bad = id(foo),
  399:     Size = id(6),
  400: 
  401:     true = is_record(Rec, Good, Size) orelse error,
  402:     error = is_record(Rec, Bad, Size) orelse error,
  403: 
  404:     %% GH-7298: Zero size.
  405:     TupleA = id({a}),
  406: 
  407:     false = is_record(TupleA, a, 0),
  408:     false = is_record(Bad, a, 0),
  409: 
  410:     ZeroF = fun(A) when is_record(A, a, 0) -> ok;
  411:                (_) -> error
  412:             end,
  413:     error = ZeroF(TupleA),
  414:     error = ZeroF(Bad),
  415: 
  416:     %% GH-7317: Huge tuple size used to take forever to compile.
  417:     false = is_record(TupleA, a, 10_000_000),
  418:     false = is_record(Bad, a, 10_000_000),
  419: 
  420:     HugeF = fun(A) when is_record(A, a, 10_000_000) -> ok;
  421:                (_) -> error
  422:             end,
  423:     error = HugeF(TupleA),
  424:     error = HugeF(Bad),
  425: 
  426:     ok.
  427: 
  428: record_access_in_guards(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  429:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  430:     file:set_cwd(test_lib:get_data_dir(Config)),
  431:     Opts0 = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors|test_lib:opt_opts(?MODULE)],
  432:     M = record_access_in_guards,
  433:  
  434:     Opts = [strict_record_tests|Opts0],
  435:     io:format("Options: ~p\n", [Opts]),
  436:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, Opts),
  437:     ok = M:t(),
  438:     ok.
  439: 
  440: 
  441: %% Test optimization of record access and is_record/2 in guards.
  442: 
  443: -record(r, {a = 4,b}).
  444: -record(r1, {a,b}).
  445: -record(r2, {a = #r1{},b,c=length([1,2,3])}).
  446: -record(r3, {a = fun(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  447: 
  448: guard_opt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  449:     ok = fun() ->
  450: 		 F = fun(F, [H,H|T]) when is_record(H, r) ->
  451: 			     [H|F(F, T)];
  452: 			(F, [H|T]) when is_record(H, r) ->
  453: 			     [H|F(F, T)];
  454: 			(_, []) -> []
  455: 		     end,
  456: 		 [#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=1,b=42}] =
  457: 		     F(F, [#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=1,b=42}]),
  458: 		 {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(F, [#r1{}])),
  459: 		 ok
  460: 	 end(),
  461: 
  462:     true = fun() ->
  463: 		   R = #r{},
  464: 		   if is_record(R, r) -> true; true -> false end
  465: 	   end(),
  466: 
  467:     ok = fun() ->
  468: 		 F = fun(true, B) when B#r1.a -> ok;
  469: 			(false, _) -> error
  470: 		     end,
  471: 		 ok = F(true, #r1{a=true}),
  472: 		 error = F(false, anything_goes),
  473: 		 {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(true, #r1{})),
  474: 		 {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(true, #r{})),
  475: 		 ok
  476: 	 end(),
  477: 
  478:     ok = fun() ->
  479: 		 F = fun([{a,R}=T]) when R#r.a =:= 42 ->
  480: 			     {ok,tuple_size(T)};
  481: 			([{a,R}=T]) when R#r1.a =:= 7 ->
  482: 			     {ok,tuple_size(T)};
  483: 			(_) -> error
  484: 		     end,
  485: 		 {ok,2} = F([{a,#r{a=42}}]),
  486: 		 {ok,2} = F([{a,#r1{a=7}}]),
  487: 		 error = F([{a,#r1{}}]),
  488: 		 error = F({a,b,c}),
  489: 		 error = F([]),
  490: 		 ok
  491: 	 end(),
  492: 
  493:     ok = fun() ->
  494: 		 F = fun(X, Y, Z) when is_record(X, r1) andalso
  495: 				       (is_record(Y, r2) orelse
  496: 					is_record(Z, r3)) -> true;
  497: 			(_, _, _) -> false
  498: 		     end,
  499: 		 true = F(#r1{}, #r2{}, #r3{}),
  500: 		 true = F(#r1{}, #r2{}, blurf),
  501: 		 true = F(#r1{}, blurf, #r3{}),
  502: 		 false = F(#r1{}, blurf, blurf),
  503: 		 false = F(blurf, #r2{}, #r3{}),
  504: 		 false = F(blurf, #r2{}, blurf),
  505: 		 false = F(blurf, blurf, #r3{}),
  506: 		 false = F(blurf, blurf, blurf),
  507: 		 ok
  508: 	 end(),
  509: 
  510:     ok = fun() ->
  511: 		 F = fun(R=#r{a=42}) when R#r.b =:= 7 ->
  512: 			     {ok,R};
  513: 			(_) -> error
  514: 		     end,
  515: 		 {ok,#r{a=42,b=7}} = F(#r{a=42,b=7}),
  516: 		 error = F(#r{}),
  517: 		 error = F([a,b,c]),
  518: 		 ok
  519: 	 end(),
  520: 
  521:     ok.
  522: 
  523: update_barf(R) ->
  524:     R#barf{a="abc",b=1}.
  525: 
  526: eval_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  527:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  528: 		       true = erlang:is_record(GetRec(), foo)
  529: 	       end, #foo{}),
  530:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  531: 		       (GetRec())#foo{a=1}
  532: 	       end, #foo{}),
  533:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  534: 		       (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2}
  535: 	       end, #foo{}),
  536:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  537: 		       (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2,c=3}
  538: 	       end, #foo{}),
  539:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  540: 		       (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2,c=3,d=4}
  541: 	       end, #foo{}),
  542:     ok.
  543: 
  544: once(Test, Record) ->
  545:     put(?MODULE, 0),
  546:     GetRec = fun() ->
  547: 		     put(?MODULE, 1+get(?MODULE)),
  548: 		     Record
  549: 	     end,
  550:     Result = Test(GetRec),
  551:     case get(?MODULE) of
  552: 	1 -> ok;
  553: 	N ->
  554: 	    io:format("Evaluated ~w times\n", [N]),
  555: 	    ct:fail(more_than_once)
  556:     end,
  557:     Result.
  558: 
  559: %% Thanks to Martin Bjorklund.
  560: 
  561: -record(foobar, {status}).
  562: 
  563: foobar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  564:     {ok,_,_} = x({foo, 1}),
  565:     ok.
  566: 				       
  567: get_bar() ->
  568:     #foobar{status = 1}.
  569: 
  570: x(Trans) ->
  571:     {foo, Barno} = Trans,
  572:     case get_bar() of
  573: 	Bar when Bar#foobar.status == 1 ->
  574: 	    noop(Bar),
  575: 	    Bar33 = Bar#foobar{status = 1},
  576: 	    {ok, Bar33, Barno};
  577: 	_ ->
  578: 	    Trans
  579:     end.
  580: 
  581: noop(_) ->
  582:     ok.
  583: 
  584: -record(foo_rec,
  585: 	{foo_1,
  586: 	 foo_2 = 0,
  587: 	 foo_3 = 0}).
  588: 
  589: missing_test_heap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  590:     #foo_rec{foo_2=2,foo_3=5} = missing_test_heap_1(#foo_rec{foo_2=1,foo_3=4}),
  591:     ok.
  592: 
  593: 
  594: %% Two test_heap instructions would be incorrectly merged (not allowed
  595: %% because of gc_bif instructions for addition).
  596: missing_test_heap_1(A = #foo_rec {foo_1 = _B,
  597: 				  foo_3 = C,
  598: 				  foo_2 = D}) ->
  599:     A#foo_rec {foo_1 = {C, D},
  600:   	       foo_3 = C + 1,
  601:   	       foo_2 = D + 1}.
  602: 
  603: -record(nrec0, {name = <<"nested0">>}).
  604: -record(nrec1, {name = <<"nested1">>, nrec0=#nrec0{}}).
  605: -record(nrec2, {name = <<"nested2">>, nrec1=#nrec1{}}).
  606: 
  607: nested_access(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  608:     N0 = #nrec0{},
  609:     N1 = #nrec1{},
  610:     N2 = #nrec2{},
  611:     <<"nested0">> = N0#nrec0.name,
  612:     <<"nested1">> = N1#nrec1.name,
  613:     <<"nested2">> = N2#nrec2.name,
  614:     <<"nested0">> = N1#nrec1.nrec0#nrec0.name,
  615:     <<"nested0">> = N2#nrec2.nrec1#nrec1.nrec0#nrec0.name,
  616:     <<"nested1">> = N2#nrec2.nrec1#nrec1.name,
  617:     <<"nested0">> = ((N2#nrec2.nrec1)#nrec1.nrec0)#nrec0.name,
  618: 
  619:     N1a = N2#nrec2.nrec1#nrec1{name = <<"nested1a">>},
  620:     <<"nested1a">> = N1a#nrec1.name,
  621: 
  622:     N2a = N2#nrec2.nrec1#nrec1.nrec0#nrec0{name = <<"nested0a">>},
  623:     N2b = ((N2#nrec2.nrec1)#nrec1.nrec0)#nrec0{name = <<"nested0a">>},
  624:     <<"nested0a">> = N2a#nrec0.name,
  625:     N2a = N2b,
  626:     ok.
  627: 
  628: -record(rr, {a,b,c}).
  629: -record(fileheader, {read_md5,md5,eof,trailer}).
  630: 
  631: coverage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  632:     %% There should only remain one record test in the code below.
  633:     R0 = id(#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3}),
  634:     B = R0#rr.b,				%Test the record here.
  635:     R = R0#rr{c=42},				%No need to test here.
  636:     if 
  637: 	B > R#rr.a ->				%No need to test here.
  638: 	    ok
  639:     end,
  640:     #rr{a=1,b=2,c=42} = id(R),			%Test for correctness.
  641: 
  642:     %% Cover beam_ssa_opt:ssa_opt_element/1 and friends.
  643:     error1 = check_file_header(#fileheader{read_md5=1,md5=2}),
  644:     error2 = check_file_header(#fileheader{trailer=true,eof=false}),
  645:     error3 = check_file_header(#fileheader{}),
  646: 
  647:     %% Cover sanitization of is_tagged_tuple in beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
  648:     {'EXIT',_} = catch id((catch 22)#rr.a),
  649: 
  650:     %% Cover beam_ssa_bool.
  651:     error = coverage_1(true),
  652: 
  653:     ok.
  654: 
  655: check_file_header(FH) ->
  656:     if
  657:         FH#fileheader.read_md5 =/= FH#fileheader.md5 ->
  658:             error1;
  659:         FH#fileheader.trailer =/= FH#fileheader.eof ->
  660:             error2;
  661:         true ->
  662:             error3
  663:     end.
  664: 
  665: coverage_1(V) when false#rr.b; V, "abc" ->
  666:     ok;
  667: coverage_1(_) ->
  668:     error.
  669: 
  670: -record(default_fun, {a = fun(X) -> X*X end}).
  671: 
  672: %% compiler treats records with 1 and 2 fields differently...
  673: -record(gb_nil, {}).
  674: -record(gb_foo, {hello=1}).
  675: -record(gb_bar, {hello=2,there=3}).
  676: -record(gb_rh, {mod,mid}).
  677: 
  678: %% Taken from compilation_SUITE and other places.
  679: grab_bag(_Config) ->
  680:     T1 = fun() ->
  681: 		 X = #foo{},
  682: 		 Y = #foo{},
  683: 		 {X#foo.a == Y#foo.a,X#foo.b}
  684: 	 end,
  685:     {true,undefined} = T1(),
  686: 
  687:     T2 = fun(X, Y) ->
  688: 		 first_arg(X#foo.a =/= Y#foo.a, X#foo.b =/= X#foo.b)
  689: 	 end,
  690:     true = T2(#foo{a=x,b=z}, #foo{a=y,b=z}),
  691: 
  692:     T3 = fun() ->
  693: 		 #default_fun{a=Fun} = id(#default_fun{}),
  694: 		 9 = Fun(3)
  695: 	 end,
  696:     T3(),
  697: 
  698:     %% Stupid code, but the compiler used to crash.
  699:     T4 = fun() ->
  700: 		 F0 = fun() ->
  701: 			      R1 = #gb_nil{},
  702: 			      R2 = R1#gb_nil{},
  703: 			      R1 = R2
  704: 		      end,
  705: 		 F1 = fun() ->
  706: 			      R1 = #gb_foo{},
  707: 			      R2 = R1#gb_foo{},
  708: 			      R1 = R2
  709: 		      end,
  710: 
  711: 		 F2 = fun() ->
  712: 			      R1 = #gb_bar{},
  713: 			      R2 = R1#gb_bar{},
  714: 			      R1 = R2
  715: 		      end,
  716: 		 F0(),
  717: 		 F1(),
  718: 		 F2()
  719: 	 end,
  720:     T4(),
  721: 
  722:     %% Used to crash beam_ssa_bool during its development.
  723:     T5 = fun(RH) ->
  724:                  if
  725:                      is_record(RH, gb_rh) andalso
  726:                      is_atom(RH#gb_rh.mod) andalso
  727:                      RH#gb_rh.mid /= 42 -> ok;
  728:                      true -> error
  729:                  end
  730:          end,
  731:     ok = T5(#gb_rh{}),
  732:     ok = T5(#gb_rh{mod=atom,mid=0}),
  733:     error = T5(#gb_rh{mod=100,mid=0}),
  734:     error = T5(#gb_rh{mod=atom,mid=42}),
  735:     error = T5(#gb_nil{}),
  736:     error = T5(#gb_bar{}),
  737:     error = T5(atom),
  738: 
  739:     %% With type optimizations disabled, beam_ssa_pre_codegen would insert
  740:     %% set_tuple_element instructions between the call to setelement/3 and
  741:     %% its succeeded instruction.
  742:     T6 = fun(R) ->
  743:                  try
  744:                      %% The succeeded instruction should immediately follow its instruction.
  745:                      %% Not like this:
  746:                      %%
  747:                      %%   x0/_212 = call (`erlang`:`setelement`/3), `5`, y0/_87:37, `4`
  748:                      %%   z0/@ssa_dummy:34 = set_tuple_element `3`, x0/_212, `3`
  749:                      %%   z0/@ssa_dummy:35 = set_tuple_element `2`, x0/_212, `2`
  750:                      %%   z0/@ssa_dummy:36 = set_tuple_element `1`, x0/_212, `1`
  751:                      %%   z0/@ssa_bool:13 = succeeded x0/_212
  752:                      %%   br z0/@ssa_bool:13, ^14, ^4
  753:                      R#foo{a=1,b=2,c=3,d=4}
  754:                  of
  755:                      42 ->
  756:                          ok
  757:                  catch
  758:                      _:_ ->
  759:                          error
  760:                  end
  761:          end,
  762:     error = catch T6(100),
  763:     error = catch T6([a,b,c]),
  764:     error = catch T6(#bar{}),
  765:     {'EXIT',{{try_clause,#foo{}},_}} = catch T6(#foo{}),
  766: 
  767:     ok.
  768: 
  769: %% ERIERL-436; the following code used to be very slow to compile.
  770: %%
  771: %% #slow_r{} should have about 4x as many fields for the test to be effective
  772: %% (all of them matched in slow_compilation/1), but unfortunately the memory
  773: %% use scales together with the speed so we'll run out of memory on many of
  774: %% our test machines before we reach noticeable levels (2+ minutes before the
  775: %% fix).
  776: %%
  777: %% We've therefore scaled it down to the current level, at least it it'll guard
  778: %% against excessive regressions.
  779: 
  780: -record(slow_r,
  781:         {f0,  f1, f2, f3, f4, f5, f6, f7, f8, f9,
  782:          f10,f11,f12,f13,f14,f15,f16,f17,f18,f19,
  783:          f20,f21,f22,f23,f24,f25,f26,f27,f28,f29,
  784:          f30,f31,f32,f33,f34,f35,f36,f37,f38,f39,
  785:          f40,f41,f42,f43,f44,f45,f46,f47,f48,f49,
  786:          f50,f51,f52,f53,f54,f55,f56,f57,f58,f59}).
  787: 
  788: slow_compilation(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  789:     R = id(#slow_r{}),
  790: 
  791:     [{f0,R#slow_r.f0},{f1,R#slow_r.f0},{f1,R#slow_r.f1},
  792:      {f2,R#slow_r.f2},{f3,R#slow_r.f3},{f4,R#slow_r.f4},
  793:      {f5,R#slow_r.f5},{f6,R#slow_r.f6},{f7,R#slow_r.f7},
  794:      {f8,R#slow_r.f8},{f9,R#slow_r.f9},{f10,R#slow_r.f10},
  795:      {f11,R#slow_r.f11},{f12,R#slow_r.f12},{f13,R#slow_r.f13},
  796:      {f14,R#slow_r.f14},{f15,R#slow_r.f15},{f16,R#slow_r.f16},
  797:      {f17,R#slow_r.f17},{f18,R#slow_r.f18},{f19,R#slow_r.f19},
  798:      {f20,R#slow_r.f20},{f21,R#slow_r.f21},{f22,R#slow_r.f22},
  799:      {f23,R#slow_r.f23},{f24,R#slow_r.f24},{f25,R#slow_r.f25},
  800:      {f26,R#slow_r.f26},{f27,R#slow_r.f27},{f28,R#slow_r.f28},
  801:      {f29,R#slow_r.f29},{f30,R#slow_r.f30},{f31,R#slow_r.f31},
  802:      {f32,R#slow_r.f32},{f33,R#slow_r.f33},{f34,R#slow_r.f34},
  803:      {f35,R#slow_r.f35},{f36,R#slow_r.f36},{f37,R#slow_r.f37},
  804:      {f38,R#slow_r.f38},{f39,R#slow_r.f39},{f40,R#slow_r.f40},
  805:      {f41,R#slow_r.f41},{f42,R#slow_r.f42},{f43,R#slow_r.f43},
  806:      {f44,R#slow_r.f44},{f45,R#slow_r.f45},{f46,R#slow_r.f46},
  807:      {f47,R#slow_r.f47},{f48,R#slow_r.f48},{f49,R#slow_r.f49},
  808:      {f40,R#slow_r.f50},{f51,R#slow_r.f51},{f52,R#slow_r.f52},
  809:      {f53,R#slow_r.f53},{f54,R#slow_r.f54},{f55,R#slow_r.f55},
  810:      {f56,R#slow_r.f56},{f57,R#slow_r.f57},{f58,R#slow_r.f58},
  811:      {f59,R#slow_r.f59}].
  812: 
  813: first_arg(First, _) -> First.
  814: 
  815: id(I) -> I.
